Question:
The diagram shows the resultant R of a 3.0 N force and a 4.0 N force that act at a point P.
The angle between the 3.0 N force and the 4.0 N force can be any value from 0째 to 90째.
Which value of R is not possible?
What is measured using a micrometer?

The graph shows a short journey. It is a speed-time graph.
What is the greatest speed reached?

A car of weight 11000 N moves with constant velocity along a horizontal road. A driving force of 5000 N acts on the car.
What is the force opposing the motion of the car?

A man with an open parachute falls to Earth at constant speed. The following forces act:
P the upward force of the parachute on the man
Q the upward force of the man on the Earth
R the downward force of the Earth on the parachute
S the downward force of the man on the parachute
Which two forces are a Newton’s third law pair?

A box is pulled up a rough slope, as shown.
In which direction does friction act on the box?

The diagram shows a motorcyclist leaning over in order to turn the corner to the left.
Which force causes him to turn?
Which type of force causes the Earth to orbit the Sun?

Four objects of different masses are on different planets.
The weight of each object on its planet is determined.
Which object is on the planet with the smallest gravitational field strength?
Which physical quantity does not change when a piece of copper is heated?

A single metal bolt has a mass of 34 g.
Three of the bolts are immersed in a measuring cylinder that contains 30 cm^3 of water.
The reading on the measuring cylinder rises to 42 cm^3.
What is the density of the metal?

A rocket of mass M when empty carries a mass M of fuel. The rocket and fuel travel at speed v. The engine of the rocket is fired and all of the fuel is expelled. The speed of the rocket increases to 2v.
What happens to the kinetic energy of the rocket?

Options.C: It increases by a factor of four.

Question:
A car of mass 1000 kg is driven 200 m up an incline so that it rises 50 m vertically.
The acceleration of free fall g is 10 m / s^2.
What is the gain in gravitational potential energy?

A fish is swimming 15 m below the surface of a lake, as shown.
The density of the water is 1000 kg / m^3.
Atmospheric pressure is 100 000 Pa.
The acceleration of free fall g is 10 m / s^2.
What is the total pressure on the fish?

The diagram shows a mercury manometer. The tube is open to the atmosphere on the right-hand side.
The left-hand side is connected to a container containing a gas at pressure P.
Atmospheric pressure on its own supports a column of mercury of height 756 mm.
Which height of column does pressure P on its own support?

In a weightlifting contest, an athlete lifts a metal bar of mass 20 kg fitted with a mass of 80 kg on each end.
The lift from ground to a height of 2.5 m takes 0.50 s.
The gravitational field strength g is 10 N / kg.
What average power does the weightlifter exert in providing the gravitational potential energy during this lift?

A boy is standing by the side of a lake.
The boy drops a heavy stone from a height of 2.0 m above the water surface.
The acceleration due to gravity is 10 m / s^2.
What is the speed of the stone when it hits the surface of the water?
In which situation is energy being released by the fusion of hydrogen nuclei to form helium?

Options.A: in the decay of 14 C used to date an object
Options.B: in a radioactive isotope emitting alpha-particles
Options.C: in the centre of the Earth
Options.D: in the centre of the Sun

Question:
The diagram shows a block being pulled up a slope by a force F.
The block reaches the new position at the top of the slope.
What is the work done by force F in moving the block to its new position?
Which statement about a mercury-in-glass clinical thermometer is correct?

Options.A: It covers a much larger range than an ordinary laboratory thermometer.
Options.B: It is more sensitive than an ordinary laboratory thermometer.
Options.D: Its sensitivity is affected by the constriction in the capillary tube.

Question: Which description of a dull black surface is correct?

Options.A: good emitter, good absorber and good reflector of radiation
Options.B: good emitter, poor absorber and poor reflector of radiation
Options.C: good emitter, good absorber and poor reflector of radiation
Options.D: poor emitter, poor absorber and poor reflector of radiation

Question:
The temperature of a body increases by 1째C.
Which other quantity also increases?

The thermal energy produced by an electric heater in three minutes is used to melt wax. The solid wax is initially at its melting point of 60 째C.
The specific latent heat of the wax is 220 J / g. The heater supplies 7700 J of thermal energy to the wax. Some of the wax melts.
How much wax melts?
Which row explains why a liquid has a fixed volume but does not have a fixed shape?

A fixed mass of gas is enclosed in a cylinder by a piston which is free to move.
Which combination of changes to the pressure and to the temperature must increase the density of the gas?

Light enters a glass block at an angle of incidence i and it produces an angle of refraction r in the glass.
Several different values of i and r are measured, and a graph is drawn of sin i against sin r.
Which graph is correct?

A swimming pool is lit by an underwater light.
A ray of light is incident on the water surface.
What is the correct path for the ray of light?
Which diagram shows the action of a converging lens on a parallel beam of light?
What is a feature of red light compared with that of violet light?

Options.A: A prism deviates red light more.
Options.B: Red light has a lower frequency.
Options.C: Red light has a shorter wavelength.
Options.D: The speed of red light in a vacuum is smaller.

Question: What is the ratio of the longest sound wavelength audible to a healthy human ear to the shortest?
Ultrasound is used to clean jewellery in a liquid. What is another use of ultrasound?

Bar magnets and various non-magnetic and demagnetised metal bars are placed in the different arrangements shown.
In which arrangement do the bars repel?

There is varying current in the coil of the loudspeaker shown. The loudspeaker is producing a sound. The magnet is clamped.
What is vibrating to produce the sound?

Two insulated and uncharged metal spheres X and Y are touching.
A positively charged rod is held near X and then the spheres are moved apart.
X now has a negative charge.
What is the charge on Y?

Options.A: negative and smaller than that on X
Options.B: negative and the same size as that on X
Options.C: positive and smaller than that on X
Options.D: positive and the same size as that on X

Question:
A stationary negative charge in an electric field experiences an electric force in the direction shown.
What is the direction of the electric field?

A battery consists of three identical cells in parallel.
What is the unit of electromotive force (e.m.f.) and to what is the e.m.f. of the battery equal?
The nuclide notation for an isotope of X is  A Z X. How many neutrons are there in a nucleus?

Radioactivity is used in several activities that take place in hospitals^2
Which activity never uses radioactivity?

C 14 6 is a natural radioactive isotope of carbon and is present in all living things. It has a half-life of 5700 years.
How old is a bone that is found to have only 4 1 of the natural proportion of C 14 6?

A kettle is connected to the 240 V mains supply using a plug containing a 13 A fuse.
The kettle contains water.
When it is switched on, the fuse blows. This happens again after a new fuse is fitted.
Someone replaces the fuse with a nail, and the kettle works.
What else might happen as a result of replacing the fuse with a nail?

Options.A: A very large current overloads the wiring, causing a fire.
Options.B: The kettle boils the water less quickly.
Options.C: The kettle uses more energy to boil the water.
Options.D: The water boils at a higher temperature.
